snippet: The immediate Olympic futures of the runners Oscar Pistorius and Caster Semenya remained unclear after the national championships Saturday in Port Elizabeth.
abstract: Olympic futures of South African runners Oscar Pistorius and Caster Semenya remain unclear after the national championships; Pistorius is trying to become the first amputee runner to compete in the Olympics; Semenya, whose victory at 800 meters at the 2009 world championships raised questions about her sex, retains her national title but does not reach the Olympic qualifying standard.
lead_paragraph: The immediate Olympic futures of the runners Oscar Pistorius and Caster Semenya remained unclear after the national championships Saturday in Port Elizabeth.

headline.seo: In South Africa, Semenya and Pistorius Fail to Secure Olympics Berths
headline.main: Two South Africans Still Look to Secure Berths in Olympics
headline.print_headline: Two South Africans Still Short Of Games
